prompt: Discuss major applications of educational psychology and analyze how psychological theories support student learning and motivation in school settings.

criteria.name: Understanding of Educational Psychology Theories
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of cognitive, behavioral, social, and motivational theories relevant to education.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly and comprehensively explains major psychological theories and their educational relevance.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes primary theories with some depth.

criteria.name: Application of Psychology to Learning and Motivation
criteria.description: Analyzes how psychological theories inform teaching strategies and improve student engagement.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully relates theory to classroom practices and student motivation with evidence.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains applications clearly with some examples.

criteria.name: Use of Research and Examples
criteria.description: Incorporates research and case examples linking psychology to education.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Effectively synthesizes studies and cases illustrating theory in practice.

criteria.name: Strategies Derived from Psychological Theory
criteria.description: Provides actionable instructional methods grounded in psychology.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Proposes sophisticated, evidence-based strategies for motivation and learning.

criteria.name: Academic Presentation and Style
criteria.description: Clarity, coherence, and professionalism of writing.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Write-ups are highly organized, clear, and formal.

key_points: Explain cognitive, behavioral, social learning, and motivational theories relevant to education.
Analyze their application to classroom management, student motivation, and differentiated instruction.
Use research and case studies to show effective psychological applications.
Provide practical teaching strategies based on psychological principles.
llm_questions: What educational psychology theories inform teaching and learning?
How do these theories motivate and engage students?
What does research reveal about applying psychology in classrooms?
What strategies derive from psychological theories to support learning?
How is differentiated instruction grounded in psychology?
What role does student self-regulation play in learning?
How can teachers foster positive classroom climate using psychology?
